intro: Bothriospermum tenellum var. majusculum, commonly known as the large-leaved sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal areas or dunes. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
